title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

(Amendment) (No. 03) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2022. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development (amendment) (no 03) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2022 interpretation

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Principal Regulations” means the Planning and Development Regulations 
2001 (S.I. No. 600 of 2001). 

Amendment of Article 95 of the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 2 regulation - principal regulation mean planning development regulation 2001 (s.i no 600 2001) amendment article 95 principal regulation

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 3. Article 95(2)(a) of the Principal Regulations is substituted by the
text_raw:
3. Article 95(2)(a) of the Principal Regulations is substituted by the 

following article: 

“95. 

(2) 

(a) A planning authority or the Board shall, as soon as may be after 
receiving a request, under section 146CA or 173 of the Act or 
article 117, for a written opinion – 

(i) 

give notice of having received the request to: 

(I) 

the Minister for Housing, Local Government and 
Heritage, 

(II) 

the Environmental Protection Agency, 

(III) the Minister for the Environment, Climate and 

Communications, 

(IV) in the case of the Board, the relevant planning 

authority, 

(V) 

in the case of a planning authority, the Board, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 13th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [647] 3 

(VI) where it appears to the authority that the proposed 
development would be likely to have significant 
effects on the environment in a transboundary State, 
to the relevant transboundary States, as appropriate, 
and 

(VII) any other body referred 

to 

in article 28, as 

appropriate, 

indicating that a submission or observation in relation to the 
information to be contained in the EIAR may be made to the 
authority or the Board, as appropriate, within 4 weeks beginning 
on the date of the notice, and 

(ii) notify the person or local authority who made the request 
of the bodies to whom the notice was given under 
that a submission or 
subparagraph (i) and advise 
observation in relation to the information to be contained 
in the EIAR may be made to the authority or the Board, as 
appropriate, within 4 weeks beginning on the date of the 
notice.” 

Amendment of Article 211 of the Principal Regulations

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 4. Article 211 of the Principal Regulations is substituted by the following
text_raw:
4. Article 211 of the Principal Regulations is substituted by the following 

article: 

“211. 

(1) The specified bodies for the purposes of sections 37D(2)(a), 181C(3) 

and 182E(3) shall be— 

(i) 

the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage 

(ii) 

the Environmental Protection Agency, 

(iii) 

the Minister 
Communications, 

for 

the Environment, Climate and 

(iv) 

the relevant planning authority, and 

(v) where 

to 

it appears 

the proposed 
development would be likely to have significant effects on 
the environment in a transboundary State, to the relevant 
transboundary States, as appropriate. 

the authority 

(2) In addition to the provisions of sub-article (1), the Board may invite 
submissions or observations in relation to the information to be contained in 
the EIAR from the bodies referred to in Article 213, as appropriate.” 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [647] 

GIVEN under my Hand, 
8 December 2022 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister of State at the Department of 

Housing, Local Government and Heritage
